result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erica Means

records.addlTxt:
OFF RECORD - Attorney Kremer notified the Court that she is ill and unable to attend scheduled plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned in Branch 15. Parties notified.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Erica Means in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference.  Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Parties advised:   Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Erica Means in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time for defendant to comply with the State's Offer. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.This hearing will be held  In person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Erica Means in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@02:00pm
